alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:33PM HST until January 28 at 9:45PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF MOLOKAI IN MAUI COUNTY... At 833 PM HST, rainfall over the island was light, but runoff levels remain elevated on Molokai. In addition, a new area of rainfall was poised to move over the island from the northeast. This area has rain rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. This warning includes the entire island of Molokai. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
